text: Leopold Neumer (8 February 1919 – 19 March 1990) was an Austrian football player. He played as striker mainly for FK Austria Wien. He also played for the Austrian national football team. ==Career== Leopold Neumer began his career at 1. Simmeringer SC. In 1935 he moved to FK Austria Wien. From the 1936/37 season he was regularly part of the first team. Leopold Neumer played eleven years for the team until the 1946/47 season. He ended his career after the 1953/54 season after playing for Favoritner FK Blau-Weiß and again for Simmering. ==International== He debuted on 10 October 1937 for the Austrian national football team in a 1-2 loss versus Hungary. His last match was on 14 April 1946 in a 3:2 victory over Hungary. For Austria he played four matches and scored two goals. ÖFB players profile After the occupation of Austria by Nazi Germany he also played for Germany in the FIFA World Cup 1938 versus Switzerland. ==References== ==Other websites== *Austria Wien Archiv Profile Category:1919 births Category:1990 deaths Category:Austrian footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:FK Austria Wien players Category:Austrian football forwards Category:Austrian Football Bundesliga top scorers
title: Leopold Neumer
